alert.note: Alert for Cascade Foothills in Lane County; Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 12 at 3:30AM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM FRIDAY UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY BELOW 1500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to 1 foot, highest above 2000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, snow and freezing rain possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches and ice accumulations of around 0.4 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills and Cascade Foothills in Lane County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 AM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from this afternoon through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult above 1500 feet. Gusty winds could cause white-out conditions at times near the Columbia River Gorge. Ice accumulation and gusty winds could bring down tree branches, leading to power outages. Bitter cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For elevations below 1500 feet, snow will likely begin Friday evening but will likely not accumulate on surfaces until later Friday night. Mainly freezing rain is expected for the Cascade foothills in Marion County and south while mainly snow is expected for the Cascade foothills north of Marion County. However, uncertainty remains high regarding exact snow and ice amounts, as well as exact temperatures in the Lane County Cascade foothills where there is a chance temperatures stay above freezing with minimal impacts.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
